intro: Galium tinctorium var. subbiflorum, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial with slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. This species is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, grassy areas and along woodland edges.
